page.title: 11HISTORY OF BATTLE ABBEY CONT
page.content: FOUNDATIONS REMAINED.THE FLOOR-PLANS OF THE REFECTORY AND KITCHEN ARE ALSO VISIBLE.ONLY PART OF THE SOUTH AISLE WALL OF THE CHURCH REMAINS,AS DOES THE 13TH CENTURY CRYPT,BUT THE SHAPE OF THE NORMAN CHURCH HAS BEEN OUTLINED AND THE SITE OF THE HIGH ALTAR (TRADITIONALLY THE SITE OF HAROLD'S DEATH IN THE BATTLE OF HASTINGS) IS ALSO MARKED.THE GUEST HOUSE WAS REBUILT BY BROWNE FOR PRINCESS ELIZABETH BUT NEVER USED AND WAS LARGELY DEMOLISHED IN THE 1700'S. THE GATE-HOUSE STILL STANDS AND WAS FORTIFIED IN 1338 AGAINST FRENCH RAIDS.IT FORMS AN IMPRESSIVE ENTRANCE TO THE ABBEY FROM THE TOWN OF BATTLE. THE TOWN GREW UP TO SERVE THE MONASTERY.
